critique: This document provides pensions to veterans of the Spanish-American War, Boxer Rebellion, and Philippine Insurrection, as well as certain widows, children, and dependent parents of deceased World War veterans. It appears to expand benefits and resolve doubts in favor of the veteran. It does not seem to touch on immigration, executive power, or federalism. It seems to prioritize social inclusion by providing benefits to veterans and their families. It also seems to involve government intervention in the economy by providing pensions.
